ae.core.autogen_wrapper module

class ae.core.autogen_wrapper.AutogenWrapper(max_chat_round: int = 50)

Bases: object

A wrapper class for interacting with the Autogen library.

Parameters:

max_chat_round (int) – The maximum number of chat rounds.

number_of_rounds

The maximum number of chat rounds.

Type:

int

agents_map

A dictionary of the agents that are instantiated in this autogen instance.

Type:

dict

async classmethod create(agents_needed: list[str] | None = None, max_chat_round: int = 50)

Create an instance of AutogenWrapper.

Parameters:

  • agents_needed (list[str], optional) – The list of agents needed. If None, then [“user_proxy”, “browser_nav_agent”] will be used.

  • max_chat_round (int, optional) – The maximum number of chat rounds. Defaults to 50.

Returns:

An instance of AutogenWrapper.

Return type:

AutogenWrapper

async process_command(command: str, current_url: str | None = None)

Process a command by sending it to one or more agents.

Parameters:

  • command (str) – The command to be processed.

  • current_url (str, optional) – The current URL of the browser. Defaults to None.

ae.core.playwright_manager module

class ae.core.playwright_manager.PlaywrightManager(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

A singleton class to manage Playwright instances and browsers.

browser_type

The type of browser to use (‘chromium’, ‘firefox’, ‘webkit’).

Type:

str

isheadless

Flag to launch the browser in headless mode or not.

Type:

bool

The class ensures only one instance of itself, Playwright, and the browser is created during the application lifecycle.

async async_initialize()

Asynchronously initialize necessary components and handlers for the browser context.

async close_all_tabs(keep_first_tab: bool = True)

Closes all tabs in the browser context, except for the first tab if keep_first_tab is set to True.

Parameters:

keep_first_tab (bool, optional) – Whether to keep the first tab open. Defaults to True.

async close_except_specified_tab(page_to_keep: Page)

Closes all tabs in the browser context, except for the specified tab.

Parameters:

page_to_keep (Page) – The Playwright page object representing the tab that should remain open.

async command_completed(command: str, elapsed_time: float | None = None)

Notify the overlay that the command has been completed.

async ensure_browser_context()

Ensure that a browser context exists, creating it if necessary.

async get_browser_context()

Returns the existing browser context, or creates a new one if it doesn’t exist.

async setup_handlers()

Setup various handlers after the browser context has been ensured.

async start_playwright()

Starts the Playwright instance if it hasn’t been started yet. This method is idempotent.

async stop_playwright()

Stops the Playwright instance and resets it to None. This method should be called to clean up resources.

ae.core.post_process_responses module

async ae.core.post_process_responses.final_reply_callback_browser_agent(recipient: ConversableAgent, messages: list[dict[str, Any]], sender: Agent, config: dict[str, Any])

Callback function that is called each time the browser agent receives a message. It picks the last message from the list of messages and checks if it contains the termination signal. If the termination signal is found, it extracts the final response and outputs it.

Parameters:

  • recipient (autogen.ConversableAgent) – The recipient of the message.

  • messages (Optional[list[dict[str, Any]]]) – The list of messages received by the agent.

  • sender (Optional[autogen.Agent]) – The sender of the message.

  • config (Optional[Any]) – Additional configuration parameters.

Returns:

A tuple indicating whether the processing should stop and the response to be sent.

Return type:

Tuple[bool, None]

ae.core.post_process_responses.final_reply_callback_user_proxy(recipient: ConversableAgent, messages: list[dict[str, Any]], sender: Agent, config: dict[str, Any])

Callback function that is called each time the user proxy agent receives a message. It picks the last message from the list of messages and checks if it contains the termination signal. If the termination signal is found, it extracts the final response and outputs it.

Parameters:

  • recipient (autogen.ConversableAgent) – The recipient of the message.

  • messages (Optional[list[dict[str, Any]]]) – The list of messages received by the agent.

  • sender (Optional[autogen.Agent]) – The sender of the message.

  • config (Optional[Any]) – Additional configuration parameters.

Returns:

A tuple indicating whether the processing should stop and the response to be sent.

Return type:

Tuple[bool, None]

ae.core.prompts module

ae.core.system_orchestrator module

class ae.core.system_orchestrator.SystemOrchestrator(agent_scenario: str = 'user_proxy,browser_nav_agent', input_mode: str = 'GUI_ONLY')

Bases: object

Orchestrates the system’s operation, handling input from both a command prompt and a web interface, and coordinating between the Autogen wrapper and the Playwright manager.

agent_scenario

The agent scenario to use for command processing. Defaults to “user_proxy,browser_nav_agent”.

Type:

str

input_mode

The input mode of the system, determining whether command prompt input is enabled. Defaults to “GUI_ONLY”.

Type:

str

browser_manager

The Playwright manager instance for web interaction.

Type:

PlaywrightManager

autogen_wrapper

The Autogen wrapper instance for agent-based command processing.

Type:

AutogenWrapper

is_running

Flag indicating whether the system is currently processing a command.

Type:

bool

shutdown_event

Event to wait for an exit command to be processed.

Type:

asyncio.Event

async command_prompt_loop()

Continuously reads and processes commands from the command prompt until an ‘exit’ command is received.

async initialize()

Initializes the components required for the system’s operation, including the Autogen wrapper and the Playwright manager.

async process_command(command: str)

Processes a given command, coordinating with the Autogen wrapper for execution and handling special commands like ‘exit’.

Parameters:

command (str) – The command to process.

async receive_command(command: str)

Callback function to process commands received from the web interface.

Parameters:

command (str) – The command received from the web interface.

async save_chat_messages()

Saves the chat messages from the Autogen wrapper’s agents to a JSON file.

async shutdown()

Shuts down the system orchestrator, stopping the Playwright manager and exiting the command prompt loop.

async start()

Starts the system orchestrator, initializing components and starting the command prompt loop if necessary.

async wait_for_exit()

Waits for an exit command to be processed, keeping the system active in the meantime.

ae.core.ui_manager module

class ae.core.ui_manager.UIManager

Bases: object

Manages the UI overlay for this application. The application uses playwright for the browser driver. This includes handling navigation events, showing or hiding overlays, and maintaining a conversation history within the UI overlay.

overlay_is_collapsed

Indicates if the overlay is currently collapsed.

Type:

bool

conversation_history

The chat history between user and system. Each entry contains ‘from’ and ‘message’ keys.

Type:

list[dict[str, str]]

__update_overlay_chat_history_running

A flag to prevent concurrent updates to the chat history.

Type:

bool

add_default_system_messages()

Adds default system messages to the conversation history to greet the user or provide initial instructions.

async command_completed(page: Page, command: str, elapsed_time: float | None = None)

Handles the completion of a command, focusing on the overlay input and indicating that the command has finished.

Parameters:

  • page (Page) – The Playwright Page object where the command was executed.

  • command (str) – The command that was completed.

  • elapsed_time (float | None, optional) – The time taken to complete the command, if relevant.

conversation_history: list[dict[str, str]] = []
get_conversation_history()

Returns the current conversation history.

Returns:

The conversation history.

Return type:

list[dict[str, str]]

async handle_navigation(frame: Frame)

Handles navigation events by injecting JavaScript code into the frame to manage the overlay state and updating the overlay chat history.

Parameters:

frame (Frame) – The Playwright Frame object to inject JavaScript into and manage.

new_system_message(message: str)

Adds a new system message to the conversation history.

Parameters:

message (str) – The message text to add.

new_user_message(message: str)

Adds a new user message to the conversation history.

Parameters:

message (str) – The message text to add.

overlay_is_collapsed: bool = True
async show_overlay(page: Page)

Displays the overlay in an expanded state on the given page if it’s currently collapsed.

Parameters:

page (Page) – The Playwright Page object on which to show the overlay.

async update_overlay_chat_history(frame_or_page: Frame | Page)

Updates the chat history in the overlay. If the overlay is expanded and not currently being updated, it clears existing messages and adds them fresh from the conversation history.

Parameters:

frame_or_page (Frame | Page) – The Playwright Frame or Page object to update the chat history in.

update_overlay_state(is_collapsed: bool)

Updates the state of the overlay to either collapsed or expanded.

Parameters:

is_collapsed (bool) – True to collapse the overlay, False to expand it.
